timeline.author: isapego

timeline.bodyText: Do we use TLS here to avoid redundant copies on put from platform side? Looks a bit complicated.
timeline.author: isapego

replies.bodyText:
Yes, when .NET performs Put, we already have a value on .NET side, no need to send it back through the callback.
Before this TLS optimization we had a 50% perf drop on Put when Platform Near is enabled. After TLS optimization the drop is about 7%. I think this added complexity is worth it.
replies.author: ptupitsyn

timeline.bodyText: I don't think this is a good name for this method as it does not say anything for person reading the code. I actually had to go to implementation of context() method in PlatformNoopProcessor to understand it's meaning. Maybe hasPlatformRuntime() or isPlatformNode() would fit better here?

+ * Additional near caching mechanism on platform side (.NET). + */ +public class PlatformNearCacheConfiguration implements Serializable {

replies.bodyText: Why not? To me it looks like a good idea to allow user to configure this from xml.
replies.author: isapego

replies.bodyText:
Agree with @isapego . Another thing is that we can't (trivially) avoid this, because configuration needs to be sent across entire cluster, so this has to be a part of CacheConfiguration.
Relevant dev list thread: http://apache-ignite-developers.2346864.n4.nabble.com/NET-Near-Cache-new-flag-in-NearCacheConfiguration-java-td45961.html
replies.author: ptupitsyn
